dialogues.text: So?  You're going to nuke the monkey house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just one room.  About a hundred "cynos."  Synergy's stonewalling. They're still arguing.  CDC is low keying the whole thing to "John Q." Gerry whistles his disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. put me in charge of the monkey operation.  I'm looking for "a few good men -- AND women."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Army S.W.A.T.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Special Forces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, Jaxx, you don't need the Green Berets.  I've got more military experience handling diseased animals than even anybody at RIID.  I'm your first volunteer. Gerry takes her in his arms.  She breaks off troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen this look on you before. This is the "our daughter needs a training bra stare."  You're worried about the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're growing up so fast.  I was thinking -- if anything happens... to either of us, I'd feel better if the kids where someplace safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can send them down to my folks for an early holiday... So they miss a couple of days of school before Thanksgiving.  They won't mind -- Gerry holds her to him.  She gets a chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is "closehold" info.  We can't even tell Jason and Jamie why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry loads the kid's duffels in his pickup.  Jaxx says goodbye to Jamie.  Jason hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Hon.  We're going to be real busy at the lab and -- Jamie instantly goes on the offensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and you just don't want me around when you off a bunch of defenseless guinea pigs.  Right? Jamie pulls away from their embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie -- I'll explain it all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad got out of the army.  Why can't you? Silence.  Jamie climbs in and slams the door glaring at her mother through the windshield. Jaxx puts on a braveface --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you Thanksgiving.  Tell Popsy and Mama to bring their appetites. Love you... -- watching them leave.  Blackhawk barks them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pastoral farm.  Sheep and Goats graze.  Several horses roam the corral.  The oddity is the ARMY MEN AND WOMEN assembled at the barn in camouflage fatigues.  Officially they are classified as "91 Tango Animal Handlers."  The Veterinarians Corps.  Jaxx addresses them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General Public pretty much believes we're into biological warfare and torturing animals for research -- I know my daughter does -- Laughter ripples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know our mission is to save human lives on the battlefield -- Most are in their "teens."  Klages is there with SGT. PIERRA, her boyfriend.  Godwin holds a baby goat feeding it milk from a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we have a chance to do just that right where we live.  This operation involves a high degree of risk. You'll be working in a densely populated area under close quarters to euthanize diseased animals infected with a rare and most deadly pathogen. Grave faces stare back at her.  She tries to lighten up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- the Green Berets passed. Fighting viruses doesn't suit their image, they say.  The Navy Seals chickened out.  You're 91 Tango Animal Care Specialists!  You're better trained for this operation than any branch of the military! Big reaction from the young group.  Klages and her Boyfriend lead the whoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is on a volunteer basis.  I can't tell you how important our success is to the safety of thousands of innocent people. This brings everyone down to earth.  Klages squeezes her Boyfriend's hand and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to help, Colonel. Jaxx nods.  Klages is only a few years older than Jamie. Immediately her boyfriend "volunteers" too.  Then another

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  This is closehold info. We don't want a panic before the operation.  No discussion with family or friends.  Am I clear? Godwin pipes up with her goat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, Jaxx, M'am.  My folks had to sign a waiver for me to get in the Army.  I'm still 17.  I don't want to miss this -- Jaxx beams with pride at the bravery of these kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be proud to have you, Pvt. Godwin.  But you need a note from your mother. Laughter.  Godwin is embarrassed.  Jaxx gives her a Mom hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx spots Johnson feeding a big Clydesdale.  She enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we have the first bio-hazard team in U.S. history --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter what kind of war it is -- we still send kids to do the fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent mine to Grandma's house. Johnson grins, then sees Jaxx isn't trying to be funny. Silence.  He handfeeds more oats to the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at one of life's true mysteries. Jaxx eyes him, puzzled.  He leads the horse out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ebola won't even make this horse even a little sick, a dumb animal. But the same bug can wipe out the most intelligent species on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you wonder who's the smarter species -- Us or Them... Johnson turns the horse loose.  It bolts into the pasture Jaxx looks at him long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find the viruses beautiful, don't you... It's not a question.  It's her scientific observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  Looking at Ebola under an electron microscope is like looking at a gorgeously wrought ice castle. The thing is so cold.  So totally pure.

dialogues.speaker: THE PASTORAL SETTING AROUND THEM
dialogues.text: The upper Potomac gleams before the Appalachians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These viruses have been on Earth a long, long time.  Along comes the human invasion.  Too many people violating the habitat. He picks up a handful of hay to illustrate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We clear a forest, the virus comes out.  It doesn't "emerge."  We crash right into the bugs.  Bam. Epidemic.  Our population gets thinned out.  This is nature. -- tossing strands away until the last straw remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiping us out?  It can't get that far -- can it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's safe from this bug, Nancy. None of us -- Jaxx reaches out taking the last straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN TO:  TINY; reading the notice in the maintenance room.  His eyes are red.  He's sweating.  Deke, the handler who looks like a Biker, is panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this 'sposed t'mean -- ? Tiny wipes his forehead.  He's spooked but hides it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, just "monkey flu," prob'ly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is jammed with HANDLERS and LAB WORKERS. Two EIS OFFICERS in white military style uniforms sit at the desks interviewing People one by one and taking blood samples.  TINY is next in line before Deke. GIRARD ROAMS uneasily.  Everyone in the room looks uneasy REESE fields questions.  A BLACK WOMAN cuts him off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what happened in Africa.  I wanna know if I'm gonna get sick working here and maybe die 'fore my children get home from school -- This is not the "low key" meeting Reese had hoped for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please just be calm.  One of the Epidemic Investigators will take care of you. (points to EIS officers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bloodtests are confidential. If you have any of the symptoms -- call us immediately.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW ROCKETS IN ON TINY
dialogues.text: He watches his blood rise in the vial from the needle in his arm.  Squeamish -- sweat rivulets run down his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All angles.  silent.  Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx feeds her menagerie.  This could be the last time. Maggie, the old bulldog, manages to wake up for a big fac lick.  Her Parrots wolf whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ritual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys.  Eat your heart out girls. Blackhawk jumps up for a hug, almost refusing to let her go as if the dog knows there is danger ahead. Gerry enters, duffel bag in hand.  It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PVT. KLAGES exits in her civvies and gets in a waiting car driven by her boyfriend, SGT. PIERRA.  They drive on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PVT. GODWIN talks on the phone to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, Mom, really.  I have to go, Mom.  Love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter checks his blood under the scope.  He "high-fives" air -- marking another day on his calendar.  "Three to go." He does some jumping jacks to rev himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitter cold.  Overcast.  EIGHT ARMY MEMBERS load the thre white UNMARKED VANS with anesthesia/euthanasia gear, ice chests for samples, etc.  All wear civvies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action report, Col. Nancy Jaxx. November 20th.  Assembled Team at Post, 0630.  Civilian clothes for drive to Reston to avoid attention -- JOHNSON pitches in with JAXX and GERRY loading gear. A 4 Man AIRBORNE MEDICAL ISOLATOR TEAM load an isolator stretcher -- hermetically sealed with its own air supply. Orange spacesuits with bubble helmets are stacked on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No personnel with experience in Racal spacesuits except me; I've asked the Airborne Medical Isolator Team to give technical support --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LEAD VAN
dialogues.text: Sit in back "shucking" syringes; i.e. removing the wrappers from syringes and loading them with anesthetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mood tense... Anticipation high... They eye the stretcher warily as it's loaded.  Casualties

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few PEOPLE are going to work in other buildings.  GIRAR PARKS in front of Synergy.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Deke, the handler, is standing on the lawn wearing a respirator, gloves and heavy jumpsuit. Girard gets out furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing outside?  People can see -- Deke suddenly raises his respirator, drops to his knees and vomits.  Girard recoils.  "Scared shitless."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Vans creep in rush hour traffic.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LEAD VAN
dialogues.text: Johnson smokes anxiously reading the Washington Post.  We see the inside headline:  "Deadly Ebola Virus Found in Va Laboratory Monkey:  Animals Sent to U.S. from Philippines."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading; cringing with the words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "This virus does not spread that easily," said CDC expert Chuck Reese, "There's a low probability of someone getting infected."

dialogues.speaker: I 495
dialogues.text: The traffic stretches to the Potomac.  The Washington Monument and Capitol hill gleam white in the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And V.P., Dan Quayle said to reporters President Bush is not breaking his "read my lips" promise. It's Congress who's forcing him to ask for new taxes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOCAL NEWS plays on three TVs.  C.J. covers his phone, signaling a Deputy C.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Girard.  They've got a man down.  Get Reese -- and Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARAMEDICS carry Deke out on a litter.  Girard is scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got symptoms.  I'm evacuating the building and... I'm officially requesting the Army to destroy all the monkeys... Sterilize the whole facility...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need that in writing.  The Team's already enroute.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON FAX MACHINE
dialogues.text: It's from Girard.  C.J. reads it.  The "go ahead."

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Karl hangs up the mobile phone.  He's pumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good news is we're nuking the whole colony.  The bad news is the virus just jumped species.  A Handler went to the hospital with symptoms.  It'll be all over the six o'clock news.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD
dialogues.text: The RESTON exit sign rushes toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vans deploy on the grass behind the building.  Girard waits at the Maintenance door with the 2 EIS Officers.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: Gerry and the rest of the Team watch from the Vans as Girard and Jaxx speak inaudibly.  He hands her the keys t the building and the signed release.  He practically runs to his car -- he can't wait to get out of there. The EIS Officers head inside.  Jaxx signals.

dialogues.speaker: THE VANS
dialogues.text: AIT PERSONNEL pile out and carry equipment inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell everyone to hit the head.  Once they suit up the only place to go is down your leg. MAJ. HAINES, the AIT leader, cracks up.  Tension released

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry throws sheets of plastic over a rope dividing the back of the van into a crude changing room. THE NEAR SIDE:  Gerry and Sgt. Pierra strip naked. Shivering in the cold, they jerk on surgical scrubs. THE FAR SIDE:  Klages and Godwin laugh embarrassed. Klages starts shucking clothes.  Then Godwin.  Both freezing cold.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Jaxx joins him.  The sound of children echoes in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice neighborhood.  Kids.  Fast food.  Diseased monkeys.  Good city planning.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE TREES
dialogues.text: The playground and happy children.  Jaxx purges her guilt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're carrying out this o.p. next to children -- We should've told them -- We should've evacuated them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders.  Might start a panic.  I'd pick panic over an epidemic anyday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storeroom is crowded.  The AIT's help Klages, Godwin, Sgt. Pierra, Maj. Haines, Lt. Rice, Gerry Jaxx and Johnson into the orange lightweight RACAL spacesuits and plastic bubble helmets.  The EIS officers observe. NOTE:  This process requires one person act as "dresser" -- like putting armor on a Knight.  Brown sticky tape is applied to all seams and zippers.  Suiting up continues throughout this scene.

dialogues.speaker: JAXX ENTERS
dialogues.text: Shivering in her scrubs.  She lays down sticking her legs up.  The AIT leader spreads her suit legs.  She pulls the on.  She briefs as she suits up.  This like a cadence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they look like "K-Mart specials," but the Racals will protect you in BL4 conditions. Once again she evokes some nervous laughter releasing tension.  She straps her battery pack blower on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got six hours on the air pump battery.  So decon out before it fails or you're in trouble. She holds up a roll of sticky tape --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These suits are fragile.  Monkey claws and fangs'll slice them like butter -- If you get a rip -- She easy rips a rend in her leg spooking everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- tape it shut fast or contaminated air can flow inside.  I keep extra tape around my legs just in case. She tapes the rend shut.  Gerry checks the seal.  GODWIN AND KLAGES look at each other.  "What've we done?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be exquisitely careful.  Stick with your buddy.  Watch for rips in each other's suits. She pulls on her gloves and tapes the wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know where your hands are at all times.  If you get blood on you, stop and clean it off.  With bloody gloves, you can't see holes in them. Believe me, I know from experience... Gerry? Gerry holds up a syringe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never hand a used needle to your buddy.  If a needle comes out of its cap, it goes straight into an animal -- He fixes the syringe on the end of a special pole with a syringe clamp on the end.  A deadly spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't recap it.  You could stick yourself.  Bag it. He removes the syringe and drops it in a disposable bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone decons out to the cold side for a fifteen minute break every two hours.  If you get tired, or sick -- tell your supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BIO-HAZARD TEAM
dialogues.text: Godwin, Maj. Haines, Lt. Rice, Maj. Powell, Gerry Jaxx an Karl Johnson.  One by one, the AIT Team fit clear bubble helmets over their heads and tie them in place. Klages' suit pressurizes making her look fat.  Nervous giggles.  Lots of sweat.  All excited and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl... Anything to add...? Johnson takes a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to euthanize a whole building full of animals as humanely as possible.  Remember, they're sick and dying.  They were caught up in this... It's not their fault. Faces in helmets.  Grimset.  Scared.  Air blowers kick on one by one.  FM headsets activate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget for a second -- they carry the most deadly virus known. Let's go.  We'll go in by twos -- The Team grabs up gear and line up like paratroopers -- Gerry presses his helmet to Jaxx's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to kiss you good- bye, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the air, Ger.  Watch your "six." She points behind him.  The Team is smiling at them. Jaxx presses her helmet to her lips with her pointer finger then presses it to him.  Their eyes say it all.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Push in on the Red Trefoil Biohazard symbol until it fill the view --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staging area door opens slowly.  Light spills into th long dark hallway leading to the holding rooms.

dialogues.speaker: GERRY AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Step into the "gray zone."  The air is heavy.  Dense.  No sounds from the monkeys.  Gerry instantly pours sweat. Their helmets fog up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit -- can't see.  It's burning up in here.  Must be 90 degrees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thermostat?  Let's find it. They head into the musky corridor.  Fluorescent lights glow that "end-of-the-world-red" in the heavy musky air.

dialogues.speaker: TO JAXX
dialogues.text: One breath and she LEADS THE TEAM in by twos. KLAGES AND GODWIN pause at the door.  WE HEAR:  their breathing, the rush of air, their heartbeats.  They squeeze each other's hands, and enter --

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW JOHNSON AND GERRY
dialogues.text: Fogged helmets.  Air pump rushing.  Poor vision.  They turn the corner at the cage washing area --

dialogues.speaker: BEINGS IN SPACESUITS
dialogues.text: Coming right at them.  The Handlers look at each other. They're in jeans and t-shirts.  What the hell is going on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?! This is a hot zone -- Loc, the Vietnamese, points to the dismantled thermostat and speaks rapidly in his language.  Johnson understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Vietnamese)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't mean "heat" -- "death." "Killing field."  Leave now. They escort the two frightened Men away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two frightened men enter.  Gerry slams the door behin them.  The two EIS officers on duty look up surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS:  KLAGES AND GODWIN lay out necropsy tools on bleed table; scalpels, cutters, lancets, pipettes, blood syringes -- the "sharps." PIERRA sets out rows of "kill syringes."  RICE stacks plastic bags and biohazard body boxes.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JAXX AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: They pause at the door to Room "F."  Karl carries a mop handle with a "U-shaped" prong on the end to hold the monkey.  Jaxx carries the pole and a bag of syringes.  Sh signals down the hall to: GERRY AND MAJ. HAINES; Ready at Door "H."  Gerry counts three -- they enter.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HELMET
dialogues.text: Johnson pushes open the door with his broom handle.  It's dark.  Visibility poor.  Instantly MONKEYS screech and rattle about.  An unnerving cacophony in the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynos haven't been fed.  They're freaked -- Hunger gets them hostile.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHING. PAWS CLAWING AT US THROUGH THE BARS.
dialogues.text: TO JOHNSON:  Sounds of Africa surround him.  He blinks.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: Faces of the dead.  Burning huts.  The big Male standing four feet tall on his hood screeching at him --

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Screeching from its cage.  Karl jerks back breathing hard JAXX APPEARS beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl?  Karl!  You okay? He nods, his heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving from cage to cage with precision and rhythm; HAINE PINS a monkey with the mop handle O.S., GERRY THRUSTS his pole syringe in the cage injecting the animal O.S.  Gerry dumps the used syringe and loads another.  They move like a martial arts kata.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children play enjoying the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People come and go at the McDonalds across the street. Down the block at the Amoco Station, more mundane life. The Grocery store advertises "Butterball Turkeys."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deke lays sedated in an oxygen tent.  Reese is there with TWO HOSPITAL OFFICIALS and MEDICAL STAFF who are nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full barrier gear; scrubs, gloves, masks must be worn.  I don't want any other patients on this floor until we do the bloodwork and find out if he's really contracted the virus. C.J. pulls him aside.  The Doctors talk uneasily O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him back to the post.  Our medical slammer has BL4 isolation. Our med-staff are trained for this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll contain it here.  Protecting the public from infectious diseases is our jurisdiction.  Don't make a scene, C.J., please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scene?  This guy's bloodwork was done here in their lab.  If it's lethal with virus and contamination occurs, this hospital will go up like wildfire. Reese escorts C.J. politely from the room.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Klages bags liver and spleen samples and puts them in a cooler full of organs.  Her gloves are covered in blood. She washes the bloody table with Clorox then places another monkey down.  She picks up a swab and takes a nos sample, flips it, takes another --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawing blood from a sedated monkey.  (Only syringe and part of monkey hindquarter visible).  As blood fills the tube; TILT UP TO:  GODWIN singing softly to the monkey, like mother to child -- Eric Clapton's "Tears in Heaven." As she places the blood vial in a box filled with blood samples, we see she is crying.

dialogues.speaker: PIERRA
dialogues.text: He fumbles for a scalpel with his gloves. He slits the top from a cadaver bag and peers in.  (We don't see what he sees).  His breathing is rapid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't breath in here. Klages turns to him.  Checking him out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SUIT
dialogues.text: Sweat rivulets run down his forehead into his eyes.  His faceplate fogs up.  He wipes instinctively with his glove smearing the visor on his wet face making it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me outta this fuckin' thing!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE SUIT
dialogues.text: He wipes his faceplate violently with his glove.  The scalpel in his hand slices the clear plastic bubble open. Air rushes out.  He goes nuts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck!  I'm leaking!  Oh shit! KLAGES FORCES the scalpel from his hand.  He flails, knocking over the tray of sharps.  His airhose uncouples. GERRY ENTERS the Gray Zone on the double.  He grabs Pierr from behind pinning his arms back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant!  Look at me! Pierra does -- military reflex.  Klages, in control, rips a piece of brown sticky tape from a roll on her sleeve -- and tapes shut the tear in his faceplate. Gerry rehooks his hose.  Air rushes in.  His suit holds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Okay!  You're not losing air pressure. Pierra instantly calms.  He smiles sheepishly at Klages -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... buddy... -- and faints on the floor in his clumsy suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry and Klages help Pierra through the door.  Rice and Haines instantly hose the trio down with disinfectant. Gerry is exhausted.  He's white as a ghost.  And aged --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Jaxx -- you look -- older --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meeting her gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I just felt that way. (looks around concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Nancy?  Has she taken a break yet?  Johnson? Klages indicates "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx crawls into frame on her hands and knees.  She loads another pole syringe and peers into the next cage.  She vapor locks -- staring at a very scary sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a loose one! She stands up peering around the dank dark room.  It coul be anywhere.  KARL POPS UP on the other side of the row scaring the shit out of her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw -- Jesus Christ --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so -- !  Where'd it go? He fumbles his flashlight on checking the lower cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep looking -- Something rattles in the corner.  They wheel.  Nothing. Johnson's air blower suddenly stops.  His suit begins to deflate.  He turns to Jaxx --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancyyyy -- She spanks his battery pack.  It sputters to life.  He smiles in relief.  It dies again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead.  Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving you.  I've got two minutes air in the suit --

dialogues.speaker: UP IN THE CEILING
dialogues.text: A shadowy figure moves impossibly along the ceiling right above them.  Sitting ducks.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HELMET
dialogues.text: His flashlight fans the heavy air checking the room. Sedated monkeys in their cages.  Suddenly the dim light from overhead begins to sway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fierce Green perches on the sprinkler pipes like a gargoyle -- hissing at the humans.  Gnashing fangs, blood running from it's eyes and nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I do not like this --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HELMET
dialogues.text: It leaps SHRIEKING.  Right at us.  Eyes bulging wild.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONKEY SLAMS INTO THE CAGES --
dialogues.text: Swinging wildly from one to another.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW JAXX AND JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Chasing it along the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a loose one in "K." Somebody bring a net!

dialogues.speaker: WITH JAXX
dialogues.text: She lost it.  She turns.  The 4 foot tall thing SPRINGS A HER from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JAXX AND MONKEY
dialogues.text: Lunging, snapping at her.  Jaxx grabs it's arms and legs blocking it's attack.  The infected monkey has become a primordial beast, "raptor-like," a killing machine. JOHNSON POKES it with his mop handle.  The thing sinks it fangs into the handle and won't let go -- Johnson SLINGS the monkey -- THROUGH THE AIR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey burst out the door sliding on the floor.  It takes off running. Jaxx and Johnson shove out of Room K giving chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a contagious cyno headed for the Gray Zone!

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: He turns a corner heading right for the bleed tables. GERRY ENTERS from the staging area.  He grabs a net shouting a warning. KLAGES TURNS grabbing a syringe.  The monkey rushes her - KLAGES STABS with the syringe.  The monkey leaps --

dialogues.speaker: IT RUNS RIGHT UP HER ARM AND RIGHT OVER HER HELMET --
dialogues.text: -- Leaping on the Bleed Table -- dumping samples, knockin over the blood vials, screeching at cadavers -- Gerry lunges at it with the net just missing --

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGING ROOM DOOR SUDDENLY OPENS AGAIN --
dialogues.text: Haines, the AIT Leader, looks in to check out the noise. The monkey instantly LEAPS on the man.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONKEY
dialogues.text: IT CHOMPS DOWN HARD crunching completely through the AIT Leader's hand.  Blood spews. JAXX charges hard with Johnson and Gerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a Medic in here! THE MONKEY ESCAPES through the staging room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Monkey enters; Johnson and Gerry right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door!! Daylight.  AIT VOLUNTEERS carrying boxed monkey samples t the Vans are in the way.  Gerry crashes into them.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: The back door is open.  Daylight.  JOHNSON DIVES slamming the door shut... Too late.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: Like a shark attracted to the sounds of playing and laughter, it zeros in on the Day Care Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids suddenly stop playing on the swing.  More look up from the sandbox.  A little boy giggles with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkey!  Monkey!

dialogues.speaker: THE MONKEY
dialogues.text: Bounding toward them.  Three SPACE PEOPLE in spacesuits are chasing it.  With nets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the children inside!  Run!  Get away!  Get away from it!

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: KIDS run away in all directions.  A TEACHER grabs two TODDLERS screaming at the others to run.

dialogues.speaker: THE JUNGLE GYM
dialogues.text: It heads right for it, scattering kids everywhere as it scurries about the bars hissing and screeching --

dialogues.speaker: THE SANDBOX
dialogues.text: The monkey lands -- five feet away from a traumatized TWO YEAR OLD GIRL.  She sits crying.  Too frightened to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, no -- please --

dialogues.speaker: SHE FLASHES TO
dialogues.text: Jamie sitting in the sandbox -- then Jason.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Raises to its full height -- four feet; big as a child. JAXX LUNGES landing in the sand between child and beast - her syringe in hand -- The Big Monk hisses -- and topples over dead... TO JAXX:  in shock herself.  She tries to comfort the frightened child, but holds back from touching her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay now.  Yes, yes, everything's alright -- it's okay -- The Day Care Teacher grabs the child up -- She glares dow at Jaxx with disdain.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Talk to Reporters outside Fairfax Hospital.  Reese runs the show playing down the day's events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army harvested the monkey colony as a precaution with the CDC's cooperation -- C.J. shoots angry looks at Reese trying to keep his cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have one worker who has close contact with the monkeys here in isolation but he hasn't been diagnosed with the virus yet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can assure you the virus has been contained and there is no further danger of exposure to the public --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors kick open from the lead white van. The SIX MAN AIR MEDICAL ISOLATOR TEAM jumps out carrying the Vickers Isolator stretcher double time.  MAJ. HAINES is visible inside.  His mangled hand bandaged and bloodstained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Team sets the stretcher onto a steel track protruding from a hatchway in the building wall.  The Lead Man opens the outer hatch and bangs on the inner one.

dialogues.speaker: THE ISOLATOR
dialogues.text: We are inside looking over the victim's feet.  The inner wall hatch opens.  The Team grabs both sides and shoves the isolator on the tracks -- THROUGH THE WALL AND INTO:

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING ACTION
dialogues.text: A maximum containment (BL4) intensive care hospital room. The isolator inserts inside another plastic chamber surrounding a hospital bed.  Bright lights reflect throug the plastic isolator walls. FIGURES IN BLUE SPACESUITS approach.  They insert their arms through glove ports into the isolator.  With precision, they drag Maj. Haines onto the hospital bed; then shove the stretcher out the hatch and close it. MAJ. HOSKINS, a female doctor, inspects the bandaged hand while other hands cut away the man's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get some antivirals in him. Ribovirin -- 40cc's -- 60 Interferon -- DOCTORS hook I.V. bags of antivirals to the victim.  Maj. Hoskins injects Haines with a sedative to calm him down.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ISOLATOR
dialogues.text: The Spacesuit Doctors all move in eerie slow motion.  The scene looks like a UFO Alien Abductee's nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect fall day.  Crisp blue skies.  Last Autumn leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN FROM:  Peter ceremoniously places his blood on the electron microscope.  Tense, nervous.  This is it.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME JAXX'S BACKYARD
dialogues.text: Jason blitzes with Blackhawk.  Karl pumps and throws --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pumps his fist in triumph.  We follow him to the wall calendar where he marks a big red "X" through "E" day. Thanksgiving.  He made it. SUPER:  THANKSGIVING DAY, 0930 HRS.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: JAMIE FAKES and cuts around Gerry.  Gerry leaps tipping the football -- RIGHT INTO JAMIE'S HANDS.  She runs. C.J. can't catch her.  She's too fast -- he's out of shape.  Jamie scores, throws an aerial and spikes the ball.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDELINES
dialogues.text: Nancy, with POPSY and MAMA, Gerry's parents, hoot and holler from the deck. Gumby, the Kinkajoo, turns one flip after another as it scampers to Jamie and jumps in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter exits jubilant, savoring the sun.  His WIFE, GAYLE and TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS descend on him from the car in a massive group hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry opens the front door.  It's Peter and his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who's coming to dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- everybody -- The guest of honor has arrived. Gerry leads Peter, Gayle and his family into the den wher the gang is watching football on TV. C.J. is up pumping Peter's hand, genuinely thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clean.  No big "E" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this bug's for you -- I mean "Bud" -- Pete cracks up.  Jamie brings a tray of beers and picks u empties.  Peter and C.J. clinks fresh cans and swig. FOLLOW JAMIE; she shakes each can on the way back to the kitchen.  Ah, a swallow.  She looks around and takes the swig.  Not bad.  Not good either.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Jaxx checks the turkey in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes everybody! Gayle sticks her head in.  She theatrically wipes her forehead and lets out a big "WHEW."  Jaxx stops what she' doing and gives her a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MENAGERIE SUNPORCH
dialogues.text: The Gang reacts loudly to the football game off in the other part of the house.  Karl is alone in the room fixed on the exotic birds. Jaxx sticks her head in, then quietly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reminds me of the jungle.  Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to feed them everyday.  Uh -- Pete's here.  Looks good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not over enthusiastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  Well?  Aren't you glad I forced you out of retirement? He studies her as if trying to place her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  I'm just not so sure we dodged a bullet like Pete says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever shut down?  Relax? She leads Karl by the hand firmly toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Decon Team's nuking the monkey house right now.  It'll be the only spot on the planet where not one living thing exists --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, but we did not quarantine the monkey handlers and the other employees.  Any one of them could be viral bombs walking around out there somewhere waiting to go off. He gestures to the outside world.  Jaxx glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- Happy Thanksgiving --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Everybody's pitching in.  She squeezes Karl in between C.J., Gerry, Jason and his Grandfather at the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this guy to work before he broods to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Karl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halftime -- As if to explain their actions.  Peter slips a baggie on each of Karl's hands and shoves them in a batter bowl. The guys are balling hush puppies and dropping them in th Sunbeam electric skillet.  Gerry throws a touchdown puppy to Peter who feigns a slam dunk into the skillet.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUNBEAM SKILLET
dialogues.text: The Hushpuppy drops in the skillet and sizzles in oil.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SUNBEAM SKILLET
dialogues.text: A Heat-suited DECON TEAMER drops a handful of "para- formaldehyde" crystals into the skillet.  They sizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIEW TRACKS ALONG 10 extension cords -- Each running the length of the "gray zone" -- one veers off into each room.

dialogues.speaker: WE TURN INTO
dialogues.text: It's completely barren and spotless.  The cord connects u 8 Sunbeam skillets.  All set to "high."  Formaldehyde crystals fry -- PLUMES OF LETHAL GAS BILLOW UP --

dialogues.speaker: IN ROOM H
dialogues.text: More skillets billow gas.  Moths drop to the floor dead. Two Mice run from behind the monkey cages... and die.

dialogues.speaker: A STEAMING TURKEY FLOATING THROUGH THE AIR
dialogues.text: Cooked to perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry parades the turkey through the house leading everyone into the dining room.  Peter sets his beer can down as he follows the crowd. JAMIE MOVES INTO FRAME:  She picks Peter's can up with some others.  It's not empty.  She takes a swig.  She feels someone watching in mid-chug.  She turns -- TO JASON; watching her in mock brotherly shock. Jamie comically CRUSHES the can in her hand indicating he can expect the same treatment if he snitches.  Jason laughs at her over-the-top-macho-girl act .

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN
dialogues.text: We hover like God above the table and feast.  Pure Americana.  Everyone joins hands around.  Heads bowed. Gerry's father says the blessing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us pray -- We give thanks -- this day, for family and friends --

dialogues.speaker: THE PRAYER CONTINUES OVER
dialogues.text: CHUCK REESE, his FAMILY and FRIENDS, gather round for their own celebration.  The Waiter and Waitress deliverin the food and dressed as Pilgrims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRARD bows his head with his WIFE, FAMILY and GRANDCHILDREN around their table. PUSH IN CLOSE ON GIRARD:  head bowed, eyes closed.  Ever so slowly, a crimson stream of blood rolls from his nose and trickles onto his plate.  He looks down startled --

dialogues.speaker: HIS PLATE
dialogues.text: He's bleeding into his mashed potatoes.  A steady drip- drip-drip.  He grabs up his napkin, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Redneck/Biker bar.  Dead animals decorate the walls. TINY DANCES to the jukebox with a fresh beer.  He blows the foam right at us in slow-motion -- -- spritzing the WHITE TRASH GIRL he's dancing and smooching on.  She licks the foam off his chin.  She steals his mug, dancing seductively, drinking his beer.

dialogues.speaker: TINY
dialogues.text: Watching the girl turn him on.  We see petechiae on his cheek.  His eyes red.  A trickle of blood rolls from his nose.  He wipes it off with the back of his hand unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE ISOLATION ROOM:  Deke, the Biker Monkey Handler, looks worse.  A NURSE, wearing full barrier scrubs, glove and mask, places another anti-viral I.V. bag on his stand A WOMEN EIS officer observes.  SIRENS squeal O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics roll in LOC, the Vietnamese Monkey Handler. The poor man is curled up with severe abdominal pains.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXAMINATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Loc speaks in Vietnamese.  He's frightened.  A NURSE cleans vomit from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running a fever.  Hundred and one -- nausea --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't speak English, great. The young DOCTOR on duty examines his distended lower abdomen.  Loc winces in pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right lower quadrant pain, rebound tenderness -- where's that bloodwork? An orderly sticks his head in with chart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy's white blood count's way up.  Acute shift to the left. Atypical lymphocytes -- Loc pleads in Vietnamese.  The young Doctor thinks hard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Let's get his appendix out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON SCALPEL:  The Doctor makes the incision in Loc's lower bloated abdomen.  BLOOD spews under pressure from the opening dousing the Doctor -- Ebola Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abrupt laughter as the Men smoke cigars and tell "war stories."  C.J. scoffs at Peter's small scar on his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out -- He rolls up his sleeve and plops his arm on the table.  A ugly jagged scar travels the length of his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right -- a virus did that? Must've been King Kong's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A machete did that.  This Bolivian Chief thought the vaccine I was trying to give him was poison -- Karl saved my cojones -- Laughter.  Karl chops the table like a machete.  C.J. grabs his groin.  Karl is actually enjoying himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a deal.  The Chief would let me shoot him with the syringe -- If -- He lets everybody hang for a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd let him shoot me in the same spot with his blow gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- where'd he shoot you? Karl shys.  C.J. cajoles.  Everybody eggs him on.  Karl stands up reluctantly undoing his trousers.

dialogues.speaker: ON JAXX
dialogues.text: She cracks up with Gayle and Jamie.  Their laughter is suddenly broken by C.J.'s BEEPER.  The piercing sound has the effect of an air raid siren on the gathered. A momentary hush -- C.J. just stares at it beeping. The PHONE RINGS.  Jaxx grabs the cordless in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx's -- PUSH IN FAST:  Her horrified expression says it all. Outbreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A madhouse as C.J., Karl and Jaxx arrive.  Karl angers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not good.  The virus could be walking outta here.  Where the hell is the CDC?  They should be here round the clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing her ID)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Army.  Which way to "isolation"? A harassed ORDERLY points down the "yellow" hall.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING THROUGH CROWD
dialogues.text: PATIENTS in a crush to sign themselves out argue with distraught ADMINISTRATORS at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm discharging myself.  I don't want to catch this thing -- A TV NEWS WOMEN hounds TWO SENIOR M.D.s who are "blown."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many cases do you have?  Do you know the virus is spreading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't processed all the information yet.  The Health Department will make a statement -- Excuse us -- They hurry away.  A SECURITY GUARD blocks the News Crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young EIS Officer talks nervously on a cellular phone - AS JOHNSON, JAXX AND C.J. BARGE in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a major panic outside Lieutenant.  Don't you think you should be out there taking charge? Jaxx and C.J. flash military I.D.  The Officer is spooked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for my superior officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an "index" case? (blank look from Lt.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The person who spread the virus? Jaxx and C.J. continue right into the Isolation ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- you're not authorized -- (frazzled to Johnson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is only my second month in the field -- I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with sincere sympathy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just not ready for this.  I know. It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: HOSPITAL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Doors bang open.  C.J. pushes Deke, the monkey handler, i the Army isolator litter.  He looks bad. Karl and Jaxx wheel Loc right behind in his isolator.  He looks worse still recovering from surgery. REESE APPROACHES from the other end with EIS OFFICERS, tw ADMINISTRATORS and two SECURITY GUARDS.  A standoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not surprised to see you here, Karl.  You move fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlling his anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to stay ahead of the pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intervening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, I'm using my authority to move these patients to the Slammer. We're better equipped.  You've got your hands full here. Reese bristles.  His authority challenged in front of his own people.  He checks Loc's chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.R. opened him up for a crash appendectomy.  His peritoneal cavity was full of blood.  When they ran a check on him, they found out he worked at Synergy.  One O.R.'s contaminated -- so is the hospital lab.  A Doctor and two Nurses were exposed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (letting go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've quarantined them! Karl and Reese; face to face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm quarantining the hospital. (to his officers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contain these people and these patients -- unless they're out of the building before I make the order official -- Jaxx, Karl and C.J. eye each other amazed.  Reese has intentionally given them a chance to leave and save face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx leads Karl and C.J. with their patients to a side exit avoiding the panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  This way --

dialogues.speaker: THE E.R.
dialogues.text: Chaos.  TV CREWS are visible camped outside the entrance. POLICE have arrived.  Inside, PEOPLE besiege the staff fo attention. JAXX SEES GIRARD being wheeled in looking deathly pale. REESE spots him from across the room.  Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isolate that man immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backs to the ramp as Jaxx, Karl and C.J. roll out with th patients. The AIT TEAM jumps out and load the isolators.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: A CROWD has gathered.  Police run yellow tape across the entrance.  TV Crews throw lights on the eerie scene.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THE VAN
dialogues.text: POLICE SET UP BARRICADES right behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Ambulance blows by going the other way.  Peter anxiously searches the radio for news.  The Kids pinch an tease each other in the backseat adding to the racket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense and worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost home.  You're making your father nervous --

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: Wound up, scanning the radio for News.  Sweat beads break on his forehead.  He pushes his glasses up on his nose.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD
dialogues.text: Traffic coming at them SUDDENLY BLURS -- then clears -- Gayle watches him closely.  Peter doesn't let on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up in the driveway.  The kids unload.  His wife gets out to follow -- Peter stays behind the wheel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gayle?  I'm going back to the lab. They might need me -- Gayle stops cold.  She doesn't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, kids.  Wash your hands. Pete?  Are you okay? She moves toward his window to kiss him goodbye.  He wave before she can get too close and backs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be long.  Promise -- PUSH IN CLOSE:  Gayle knows something is wrong.  Please, God, no.  She wipes her brief tears so the kids won't see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petechiae begins to pop out on his face.  His tear dusts bleed red.  He sweats feverish.  He fights to see the roa -- It's got him.  The bug is eating him --

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The Guard waves him through.  His vision blurs in and out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter covers his mouth and waving people away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Jahrling -- are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jahrling.  He flops on the chair beside the isolator, sticks a thermometer in his mouth, ties off his arm and draws his own blood. MAJ. HOSKINS enters in the blue spacesuit and takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is jumping.  Phones ring.  Staff shout over the din.  TV monitors show News coverage on the "outbreak." MONITOR #1:  A NEWS ANCHOR stands before a world map tracing the path of the virus to the U.S.  Africa via the Philippines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey's voyage brought them by plane from the Philippines, to Amsterdam to JFK's animal unit and finally to Virginia -- carrying deadly virus.  How the monkeys contracted the African Ebola virus, the Army and the CDC can only speculate... Please call this number if you have any of the symptoms --

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: MONITOR #2:  CNN coverage from the mob scene at Fairfax Hospital.  A FEMALE ANCHOR grills the young EIS Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have five confirmed cases so far -- including three medical staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are their chances for survival? No answer.  Awkward silence. TO C.J.:  on his headset telephone barking orders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Virginia Health Departments, Maryland and D.C. to get every patient in a fifty mile radius to be transferred here to RIID -- And all blood samples sent to us for immediate testing.  You heard me! A STAFFER yells from the bank of phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a case reported in D.C. C.J. sticks a pin on the map right in the capital.  He locks eyes with General Russell.  "Holy shit."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIT's shove Loc, the second Monkey Handler, through the hatch into the Slammer.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PARTITION WINDOW
dialogues.text: Shocked to see PETER; his face peppered with hemorrhages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Pete... I don't believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could all be exposed -- Jaxx shivers at the thought.  PETER RAISES UP in bed making eye contact with them.  Sadly, he mouths the words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading his lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me to call his family. Tell them he won't be home for dinner... (she nods affirmative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I copy, Pete.  Hang in there. Pete understands.  He gives her "thumbs up" and sags back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fridge full of deadly viruses is visible through the glass.  Jaxx sadly hangs up the phone.  Karl is with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slammer's already full and this thing is just getting started. C'mon, don't just stand there.  Get mad!  Say, "I told you so."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to save lives.  We both know none of the antivirals we've got is going to pull these people through.  They'll be soup in a week.  We need a super immuno serum to even have a chance to save anyone.  We need a survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's get one!  If we can pull Pete or any one of these patients through, the immunities in one person can save four more with their antibody serum.  Then sixteen and -- She fixes on Pete's guinea pigs through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's got guinea pigs here that are immune to Ebola, a Supermonkey who's beat it.  I'll bleed these animals dry and spin off some immuno plasma. She's on fire.  A heightened urgency to her every word --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't despeciate enough serum from those guinea pigs and mice to treat an epidemic!  We should've been stockpiling years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the fuck would you do? Pete's dying in here -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a "magic bullet." Jaxx instantly understands.  She actually smiles --

dialogues.speaker: THE REFRIGERATORS
dialogues.text: Jaxx pulls out 4 units from plasma storage and sets them on the bench reverently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Genevieve.  The last four units you brought back from Africa. "Gold-plated" Ebola-eater. Karl savors the container -- his long lost friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give the last of Sister G. to Pete... There's a good chance the serum will give his immune system the boost he needs to beat the bug... We owe it to him. He wipes a stray tear from her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.  Try it.  Try everything.  I wish I'd had ten of you in Africa and Panama -- Bolivia -- India -- Jaxx doesn't know how to react to the compliment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this epidemic will be hopelessly out of control if we can't get the viral bombs off the street who're out there exposing innocent people. Jaxx takes Sister G's plasma with grim resolve and heads down the corridor.  From the back, we see her shoulders shudder.  She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx gives Peter the best she has to offer; she hooks one of the last units of Sister Genevieve's convalescent Seru to his I.V.  He forces a smile from his isolator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what flavor is that?  I ordered pistachio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff will rot your teeth. This is Sister "G."  Nothing but the best for you, Pete. Pete is at a loss for words.  Jaxx won't let him speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Sister would've wanted you to have it.  Get well. She reaches in through the glove port and daubs the sweat on his face.  Hemorrhages have popped out all over. The intercom BUZZES breaking the moment.  More trouble. Peter turns away in tears.  As Jaxx leaves.  PAN UP TO: The last of Sister Genevieve drips slowly into Pete's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got every other handler and employee in quarantine -- but we can't find him; "Timothy Whippert." C.J., JAXX AND JOHNSON go over Tiny's personnel file with the exhausted young FEMALE EIS OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is that handler who dumped those hot cadavers on us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkout his blood test. Johnson pours over the Titre chart in Tiny's file.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHART
dialogues.text: Three categories.  "Anti-Ebola," "Anti-Marburg," "Anti- Simian HF."  "O" appears in everything but "Anti-Ebola." It's got numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.  High-titres.  Plus four, plus three, plus four -- Jesus he's crawling with Ebola anti-bodies. He's a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long ago did he react?  Do we know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EIS just found out he cut himself doing a necropsy on a hot cyno about two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's got symptoms, he is a walking lethal contagion, one.  And two, he's either dead, or almost dead by now -- or three -- He's immune -- Johnson turns to Jaxx -- She's almost afraid to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survivor -- Match in a haystack.  This is it -- the whole room ignites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made contact with his mother.  She said he'd gone to the mall to the movies.  Apparently, he's a 'Bruce Willis' die-hard fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  What mall?  C'mon -- c'mon. She points to a spot on the map.  Karl is hyper-alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epidemic scenario.  Worst case.  A viral bomb roaming densely populated areas is more dangerous than a "serial killer." Silence.  Then the room goes into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's bring him in.  And no Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screeching to a halt in front of the Mall entrances. TROOPERS pilling out and taking up positions at the doors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammed with holiday MOVIEGOERS, SHOPPERS and CRUISERS.

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING THE CROWD
dialogues.text: "Look Who's Talking" on the screen.  WE HEAR:  BRUCE WILLIS cracking up the audience as the Baby. WE SEE:  TEENAGERS kissing passionately on the back row. Their tongues all over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aerosol droplets glisten like snow in projector light.

dialogues.speaker: TO JAXX
dialogues.text: Scanning the crowd with an infrared night scope.  The COUGHING AMPLIFIES, LOUDER, LOUDER, in Jaxx's mind.  She finally covers her ears, it's so annoying.

dialogues.speaker: THE MALL
dialogues.text: Patrolling long "MOVIE" lines of PEOPLE spilling into the main Mall.  "BACK TO THE FUTURE 2," "LITTLE MERMAID,"

dialogues.speaker: "LOOK WHO'S TALKING," "MY LEFT FOOT."
dialogues.text: He checks his Xerox of Tiny's photo, looking, searching.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: A virologist's nightmare.  Everywhere he looks he sees germs spreading.  Two TEENAGERS sharing puffs on the same cigarette. Countless runny noses.  People COUGHING -- A COUGH BLASTS in Karl's direction, he brushes his jacket off as if Tarantulas were crawling on him. A MAN AND WOMAN eat from the same popcorn box with their two CHILDREN.  One child eats stray kernels off the floor unobserved by his parents.  The other wipes her runny nos with her bare hand then sticks the same "wet" hand in the popcorn box.

dialogues.speaker: MCDONALDS, (JAXX POV)
dialogues.text: FOUR FAST FOODERS eat with their hands.  All double dip their french fries in the ketchup after each bite. TO:  JAXX; Now on stakeout in the "food halls" area.  She makes eye-contact with Karl and "thumbs" to the door. TO POLICE:  Standing out like sore thumbs at the entrance They're wearing surgical gloves.  Several sport surgical masks.  They cause a stir stopping SHOPPERS to show them Tiny's picture for a reaction. TO JOHNSON:  He's steamed.  Cops.  He mimes putting on surgical gloves then blowing his brains out.  He looks back to Jaxx -- His adrenalin starts to pump --

dialogues.speaker: JAXX
dialogues.text: The Man is nodding, absolutely sure, pointing to Tiny's photo.  He turns and points to the public eating area.

dialogues.speaker: PANNING TO
dialogues.text: There's Tiny.  Sitting alone woofing down burgers in overalls and hunting shirt. JOHNSON WENDS through the tables, circling the big man. JAXX CLOSES on the opposite side talking on a hand radio. THE FEMALE EIS OFFICER reacts on her radio and signals to two other EIS OFFICERS through the crowd.  They close.

dialogues.speaker: MOVING CLOSER
dialogues.text: He can almost reach out and tap the big man's shoulder. TWO POLICE suddenly spot Tiny from the other side and hea right toward him through the tables. TINY spots them, bolts up and heads into the crowd -- JOHNSON hurries after him pushing through people.

dialogues.speaker: MALL HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Tiny is now running bulling his way through the crowd. The Police in hot pursuit.  Johnson runs trying to get between Tiny and the Police --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right there!  Stop!  Freeze it!

dialogues.speaker: ON TINY
dialogues.text: He reaches inside his overalls as if to draw a gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear!  Get outta the way! People hit the deck.  JOHNSON BULLS PAST the Police -- JAXX FIGHTS her way through the fleeing crowd --

dialogues.speaker: TO TINY
dialogues.text: -- and turns struggling to pull his hand out --

dialogues.speaker: GUN AIMED
dialogues.text: Johnson is in his line of fire -- Suddenly JAXX ENTERS frame disarming the Cop with her self-defense wrist lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood could be more lethal than your gun -- Jerk -- stupid -- KARL GRABS TINY'S HAND and slams him into a merchant's cart of cheese and smoked sausages.  The Big Man goes dow taking the cart with him. JAXX AND POLICE rush up with the female EIS officer. The Big Man on the floor pulls a handful of stolen CD's from inside his overalls.  It's not Tiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take'em.  Here.  That's all I got. I swear.  Jesus -- I peed in my pants. Karl pulls himself up frustrated -- angry.  Jaxx helps him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I can get up by myself. (to Female EIS Officer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do your job, Lieutenant.  You're the epidemic police.  Check him out -- People part.  Jaxx leads Johnson away.  A Policeman slaps cuffs on the Big Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you on medication? The Big Man shakes "no" as they lead him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been bitten or scratched by a wild animal? (another "no" and a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you experienced any unusual symptoms in the last 24 hours. Now the Big Man looks at his captors suspiciously; Police in surgical gloves.  Some with masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- what is this?  Y'all think I was ebb-ducted in a UFO, don't cha? The Crowd laughs.  The young EIS Officer is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl knocks on the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whippert we just want to ask you some questions about your son. We're not the police. Jaxx starts to speak.  Then a frightened voice inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I toll those other people who was here earlier where he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Whippert, he's not at the movies -- so why don't you help us? They both eye the several racks of deer antlers nailed haphazardly on the porch posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a sportsman too, M'am.  Fishing. Your son's a hunter I see -- Silence.  He looks to Jaxx.  They're warm, Jaxx adds a "mother's concern."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M'am, I know you're scared, but just understand, your son may be very sick.  As a mother myself, I know you really want to help him. A beat.  The door slowly opens.  Tiny's MOTHER peers out. Drink in one hand.  Cigarette in the other.  Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he toll me not to say nothin' to nobody when he callt yesterday. He went a huntin'.  He's on up at his cabin... Jaxx and Karl trade glances.  "He's alive"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it!  Subject was still kicking as of yesterday -- He moves to the wall map.  Two DEPUTY AIDES join him.  He puts a pin in the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin is about seventy-five miles up the Savage River from here. Get me topos and recons of this area down to the square foot -- Staff get on the phones. PUSH IN TIGHT ON THE MAP:  The pin is in the southeast corner of West Virginia.  Names like Black Rock Canyon, Big Run and Backbone Mountain appear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO AIDES in spacesuits wheel Deke's covered body by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkey handler's lifeless face frozen in horrible agony, skin disintegrating, disappears as gloved hands zi the body bag over him.  The body slides into the rack. The big submarine door closes.  Gloved hands crank it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl is loading a field isolator into a Huey with an AIT Team.  Inflatable rubber rafts follow. A government vehicle drives right across the open field -- lights flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver stops.  Chuck Reese gets out and faces Karl in the flashing lights.  Johnson is hardly glad to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost the first monkey handler. First Ebola victim on U.S. soil. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go with you. Karl squints at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl, look, we've quarantined seventeen people this guy may have exposed.  I should have done it your way.  I... stayed behind in Africa all those years ago.  In a way, I guess I stayed behind ever since... Not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to be at the epicenter doing something about it -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats catching it in the Men's room at the Burger King -- Karl's piercing stare morphs to a grin.  He picks up one end of a field container, Reese the other.  He's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx passes the Post Clinic.  She slows looking in the waiting room window --

dialogues.speaker: CLINIC WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: Tiny's Mother is there waiting to have her blood tested. A Vietnamese family (Loc's); a mother and four small children, a couple of Biker types -- the room is filled with potential exposures. In the corner, Jaxx sees the little Girl from the sandbox in the arms of her very frightened young Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hits her.  Her own home.  Her own family.  Nobody's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes in and answers the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Gerry.  I was just going to call you.  It's been so -- She pales.  Something's wrong.  She sits down hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie?  Oh my God.  Hundred and three?  When did the bleeding start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry looks spooked.  Jason broods at the glass doors. Blackhawk whines knowing something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Levin came over and gave her some antibiotics.  "A touch of the flu," he said, "A 24 hour virus."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctors always say that!  "It's the flu.  Comeback next week."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nance, we have to assume it's Ebola. Jaxx is an emotional minefield on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Thanksgiving -- when Pete was here somehow.  We may all be incubating the goddamn thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out here quick -- She hangs up.  Her world crashing in.  She sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl and Jaxx face each other.  Karl is shocked.  The Hue engine begins to whine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's got it.  Jamie has about seven days to live.  I'll find an anti-serum that works if I have to squeeze it out of my own veins -- Karl embraces her holding her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get your daughter, Colonel. JOHNSON AND JAXX - COPTER IN B.G. He salutes her and boards the Huey.  Rotors rev up.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELIPAD
dialogues.text: C.J. leads Jaxx clear as the Huey lifts off and climbs banking toward the mountains in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HUEY
dialogues.text: Karl watches her getting smaller and smaller.

dialogues.speaker: THE JAXX HOME
dialogues.text: Gerry and their Family M.D., DR. LEVIN, tend Jamie who is burning up with fever.  Both wear surgical masks.  Gerry carefully draws her blood --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't treat her here, Gerry.  We have to move her to the hospital --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wits end)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I know that. Gerry watches his daughter suffering.  He finally agrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make them understand she needs complete and total isolation. Suddenly the THUD of a helicopter approaches outside.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MENAGERIE ROOM
dialogues.text: The THROBBING intensifies.  The animals go crazy.  Jason runs outside with Blackhawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Rescue Copter lands on the hill up behind the house. JAXX CLIMBS OUT with 3 AIT's carrying an isolator stretcher. Jason has never been so glad to see anybody in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mom!  Yes! She hugs him on the run trying to hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popsy holds the door open as Jaxx and the Team enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popsy -- are you and Mama okay? He nods weakly.  Mama sets food on the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, M'am.  We can't, but thank you. They follow Jaxx to Jamie's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx nearly breaks when she sees her daughter lying there so still -- as if she's dead. Gerry braces her up.  Jaxx buries her head for a moment i his shoulder.  Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a ride, Princess. The Team gently slides Jamie into the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice faint, weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom -- all I did was sip some beer -- don't be mad -- Am I going to die? Gerry and Jaxx trade quietly desperate looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  You have to win the Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They load Jamie into the Copter along with Jason.  Gerry has to coax his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to come too.  You could have been exposed.  I can't leave you here -- Popsy and Mama look at each other in fear.  Then Popsy takes Mama's hand and helps her into the Copter.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN
dialogues.text: The Huey lifts off right at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying upriver on Johnson's copter through a canyon twenty-five feet above the river.  Just like Africa --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE JOHNSON'S COPTER
dialogues.text: He's transfixed on the rushing water glimmering in the dying sun.  SOUNDS OF AFRICA swell.  Going upriver again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- front's moving in.  Snow expected.  Be dark soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping from his trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find that cabin tonight. How much longer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes to the hot zone -- Reese hands Johnson a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a long shot, Karl.  Even by your standards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was Ebola ever crossing the Atlantic, remember? Reese nods Karl's kudos.  Karl pulls out Tiny's photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's a long shot to survive.  So is everybody else that shows symptoms.  This guy was exposed weeks ago with the other handlers before everyone else -- He threw antibodies and was still alive two days ago -- after his partner checked into the morgue.  That's a good sign.  We'd be irresponsible not to go after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- too bad you never found that lost tribe in Africa you used to lecture us about -- You know -- the ones who passed down immunities over the generations to just about every virus emerging. (half-joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be back home fishing right now -- and we'd have all the immuno anti-sera we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what -- I would kiss that tribe member's ass on the fifty yard line at the Super Bowl if they'd just walk out of the jungle right now. Johnson toasts his coffee to Reese's.  They laugh in much needed release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- coming up on the zone --

dialogues.speaker: FLYING
dialogues.text: The Pilot turns on floodlights as they rise up from the river up-up-up a steep rugged cliff wall -- There it is.  A small cabin on a cliff overlooking the river and mountains.  Tiny's funky green Van is parked beside it.  The van doors stand open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks deserted.  Get in closer.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOODLIGHT PASSES OVER
dialogues.text: A Deer... hanging from a tree branch -- horribly dismembered and strewn about.  Entrails and Blood are splattered all over the Van and the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's lost it.  Dementia. The DRUMS OF AFRICA beat louder in Karl's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an Assault rifle opens up on the Copter.  Tiny stumbles out the front door firing wildly.

dialogues.speaker: TINY
dialogues.text: His face is pocked with hemorrhages.  Blood is caked around his nose and mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone you fuckers!  I know why you come.  I'm dying right here -- right fucking here!!

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: As Tiny rakes the trees wildly -- hitting the Copter.

dialogues.speaker: THE COPTER
dialogues.text: The Pilot dives down the canyon fighting the controls.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE IS SHOVED THROUGH THE WALL INTO THE SLAMMER.
dialogues.text: The isolator rockets toward us with a metallic crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?  Where are my Mom and Dad? Maj. Hoskins calms her through the isolator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming Jamie.  Let's get you comfortable. Hoskins and her Aide use the arm ports to take Jamie's vitals and hook her up to I.V.'s. NOTE:  since she's in the isolator, MDs wear masks gloves etc., not spacesuits. SCREAMS and RAVINGS suddenly echo O.S.  Hoskins slams the inner door to keep Jamie from hearing.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW HOSKINS THROUGH THE SLAMMER TO
dialogues.text: Maj. Haines screams in dementia next to Peter. TWO AIDES in spacesuits wheel Loc's covered body out causing Haines to lose it completely. TWO DOCTORS in Spacesuits try to subdue him in his open bed.  He trashes yanking at his I.V.'s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this shit offa me -- Hoskins aims a tranquilizer gun and shoots him with a tranq dart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loc's covered body is slid into the rack beside Deke's body bag.  The second death.  The submarine door closes.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
