dialogues.text: Jaxx enters.  She strokes her daughter with her hands in the glove ports.  Jamie squeezes them through the plastic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Jamie.  I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Dad... and Jason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's with Jason and Popsy and Mama just down the hall.  They're having their blood tested.  We're going to take some of yours too.  Check it out.  You might not be sick at all. Jamie smiles faintly.  Maj. Hoskins ties off Jamie's arm through the glove ports and thumps up a vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... this is the "slammer" isn't it?  I heard you talk about it. Jaxx nods.  She can't stand to see Jamie suffer.  She holds Jamie's hand -- the needle enters her arm.  Jamie cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full winter moon.  The AIT's have pitched camp around the Copter.  The Pilot works on the engine under generator lights.  Bullet hits are visible across the cockpit glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, C.J., I don't want Rangers and State Police up here guns blazing.  I need this guy alive. Reese listens intently trying to stay warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's no good to us with a bullet in his head.  We'll never know if his antibodies can beat the bug or not. Okay -- tell them he's contagious. That'll buy some time. (a response on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I should've brought my fishing tackle.  How's Nancy's kid.  Any word -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MICROSCOPIC VIEW
dialogues.text: It glows with Ebola antigen response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx sits back from the microscope, trembling.  She sags, dropping her head on the bench.  She weeps openly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's face tells us this is a horrible way to go.  Jaxx looks on with loving eyes.  She feels helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lousy room service.  And what happened to the sexy nurses we used to have around here -- Jaxx strikes a pose.  His laugh is like sandpaper.  He's dying and knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  I want you to give the rest of my old friend to Jamie. She's young.  The antibodies might turn her around. Jaxx doesn't know what to say.  She can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe I'm the "magic bullet," Nance.  Go on, take it.  Give Jamie a fighting chance.  I got work to do in the lab, anyway -- He unplugs his I.V. from the precious serum and sits up - Nancy has to subdue him.  Maj. Hoskins hurries in to help

dialogues.speaker: TO JAMIE
dialogues.text: Jamie.  Her face a mask.  Comatose.  Gerry checks her temperature.  Jaxx enters.  She's been crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to Jaxx)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No break in her fever.  Ribovirin's not working.  Efficacy is zero... Her fever's still up.  We need immuno serum, Nance.  None of the patients are responding... Jaxx regards their daughter.  She makes herself do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter wants her to have this. She unhooks the antiviral I.V. bag and replaces it with a serum bag marked "Sister G."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dumbfounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's better?  His fever broke? Jaxx shakes her head slowly.  Gerry reacts, overcome.  He holds Nancy close, both gazing at their daughter.  Small hemorrhages mar her youthful face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Jamie's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-o-three.  Just checked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it every thirty minutes.  If there's any drop, I don't care how slight, we'll know the serum's working.  She'll pull out.  She will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl sits hunched by river fire drinking coffee.  Everyon else still sleeps.  He's fixed on the campfire.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLAMES
dialogues.text: The sounds of Africa haunts him.  Drums pound relentlessl -- He looks up, suddenly startled.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: A beautiful AFRICAN WOMAN walks out of the bush.  She kneels across the fire from him. She hands Karl a gourd brimming with healing waters.  He reaches for it -- FLAMES SINGE HIS FINGERS. He jerks back, looking around, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: PANNING AROUND
dialogues.text: The river.  Sun coming up.  Reese is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl?  Are you alright, Karl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIT's put in the raft, holding it steady in the backwater.  Karl and Reese board. Onshore, the Pilot holds up his 9mm pistol.  An offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in guns as an equalizer.  Nature's full of equalizers more deadly... They shove off.  The AIT Leader in front, Reese in the middle and Karl at the stern.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RIVER
dialogues.text: Karl steers them into the rapids.  They move swiftly downriver.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Watching high cliffs and dense woods slide by.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: Karl crossing on the raft.  Zairean Police aiming guns.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: His fingers sinking into a dead man's arm like pudding. Village children singing to the Nuns. Sister Genevieve convulsing in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: He shivers, near convulsing.  Another river to cross.

dialogues.speaker: THE MORGUE
dialogues.text: Another body bag slides in beside six other bodies.  The tag reads:  MAJ. ARNOLD HAINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TV MONITOR:  The Local ANCHORWOMAN standing outside RII interviews C.J. by phone inside.  He's running on fumes. The Staff watches him and the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many deaths so far, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can confirm seven as a direct result of the virus -- including employees at the primate facility... and one of our own.

dialogues.speaker: C.J. CONTINUES OVER
dialogues.text: Corridor beds are now filled.  30 PATIENTS are tended by MEDICAL STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS wearing Scrubs, masks, decon suits, anything to protect against possible infection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're continuing to bring all "cases" and exposed persons here to RIID.  We'll try to contain the virus here until it burns itself out -- We're still trying to find a rescue therapy that's effective against the virus -- AIT's wheel in Girard in an isolator.  He's almost gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's Wife sleeps on a sofa with her two children. Others rest on chairs or the floor. Jaxx checks a patient who looks good.  Eyes clear. Minimal symptoms.  It's the Big Black Woman from Synergy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to nurse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check her blood again.  Maybe she has the "magic bullet" antibodies. The Black Woman smiles hopeful.  Jaxx looks past her out the glass partition into the Slammer area.

dialogues.speaker: THE SLAMMER AREA
dialogues.text: A Medic covers up another victim. Jaxx thinks that could easily be Jamie... Gerry hurries up.  Jaxx instantly panics --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her temperature's down.  One-o-one. Jaxx.  Her panic rockets to joy -- Gerry half carries her down the hall -- both euphoric.

dialogues.speaker: THE SLAMMER
dialogues.text: The last of Sister "G" plasma drips into Jamie's I.V. Jaxx reaches in the glove ports and wipes a trace of bloo from Jamie's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's responding.  It's working. Human immuno serum protocol works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're fresh out -- Goddamn bug! Gerry folds her into him.  They share a frustrated cry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I just put my life in her I.V.  Why...? They hold each other tight, praying for a miracle.  Gerry ceremoniously pulls a stuffed bear from a bag of personals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy... when she was two years old -- but she used to want "Dee Dah" the Bear when she was sick. Jaxx kisses the bear and tucks it in beside Jamie.  Jamie instinctively hugs it to her.  She wakes staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... I'm sorry I said bad things about guinea pigs -- and mice.  I know you're just trying to make me well -- Jamie drifts off.  Jaxx wells up.  She suddenly heads awa -- filled with Jamie's words.  Gerry follows --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animals -- Pete's working on synthetic antibodies -- He's growing living immune animal cells and living human cells together -- to clone a super immune cell.  So far guinea pig cells don't work.  I just had an idea -- that might --

dialogues.speaker: THE SLAMMER ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Gerry catches her as they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can mass produce antibody serum for any bug.  It would be just like having Sister Genevieve alive again -- donating her blood.  There's a way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy -- that's all theory.  Lab trials.  Nothing solid.  It could take months to get results. Gerry holds her trying to calm her down.  She fights him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not just about our Jamie anymore.  If we -- can't save her, if we lose her, think about the lives we can save in a month or a year -- Jaxx is choking back her tears, knowing what she's saying but keeping her duty to humanity always above all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do the right thing by Jamie. You always do the right thing. She breaks.  The airlock door hisses closed behind her. She hesitates at the port -- then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last question, Col. Peters; Is the the virus airborne?

dialogues.speaker: DESCENDING TO THE RIVER BELOW
dialogues.text: Tiny's cabin comes into view on the bluff.  It's snowing lightly.  The Raft.  Karl motions.  They turn into the bank.  Reese jumps out pulling them ashore.

dialogues.speaker: ONSHORE
dialogues.text: Each Man shoulders a pack of medical gear.  They begin th ascent up a steep trail.  The AIT Leader talks softly on his radio as they climb --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird dog -- we made dry land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are enroute on fire road. ETA forty-five minutes.  Half-it for their Rescue Chopper -- over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reese pulls himself up over the bluff rim.

dialogues.speaker: A MOUNTAIN LION
dialogues.text: In his face.  Fangs bared.  Reese flails back -- pulling Karl with him. KARL GRABS REESE'S HAND -- stopping each other's fall.

dialogues.speaker: THE MOUNTAIN LION
dialogues.text: It's been dead for hours.  Wedged in the rocks.  Reese checks it for wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bullet entries.  No arrow wounds. Karl wipes the blood caked around its nose on a swab, the from its mouth.  He seals it in a baggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the virus just jumped species... again.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLUFF
dialogues.text: The AIT LEADER climbs up beside them eyeing the dead animal.  Each grabs a respirator off his utility belt and slips it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No movement.  The Team chuck their equipment in the trees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Nothing.  He raises his respirator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!  Mr. Whippert!  I'm a Doctor. Do you need medical attention?! No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's gone... or dead... Karl stands to approach the house.  Reese pulls him back. TINY FIRES wildly from the window raking the trees -- -- FILLETING the ground all around them --

dialogues.speaker: ROCK MOUND
dialogues.text: Rounds rip the rocks.  Karl looks at Reese and grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive.  That's a good sign. Reese looks at him like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are certifiable --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peeking at the house)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.  Shuck me a syringe. Load it with a 100cc's of "ketamine." Another look from Reese as he opens his pack --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to anesthetize him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me.  Just got to get close enough. Reese looks at the AIT Leader.  Now he knows Karl's crazy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc, we should wait for the Cops.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE WITH JOHNSON
dialogues.text: He crawls along the rocks talking a bluestreak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Whippert!  We have medicine -- and a helicopter that can fly you to a hospital. (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been sick?  You know -- when did you get your first headache?  Fever -- ?

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: No answer.  Reese tosses Karl a pack of two syringes. Karl signals to the AIT to split up making tough targets.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JOHNSON
dialogues.text: Tiny fires wildly.

dialogues.speaker: WITH AIT LEADER
dialogues.text: The ground fillets around him.  A round rips into his leg He goes down screaming. JOHNSON DIVES behind a stack of firewood as bullets chew up the pile --

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Silence... Reese makes his way to the wounded man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no!  The Police are coming and if you start shooting you'll be dead.  I don't want you to die right now.  I want you to get well... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now -- how long have you been sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More'n a week... I think -- Can't 'member anymore -- Sorry... His voice is weak.  Strained.  Karl crawls toward the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Maybe you're getting better. Let me come in.  Check you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' way!  If the heat come, I'll shoot'em too. He fires wildly from the window.  Then clicks no ammo. TO REESE:  Dressing the AIT Leader's leg wound. TO JOHNSON:  Reaching the van.  The passenger door is open.  Karl checks it out.  Keys?  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how you feel, Tiny.  I can help you.  Walk out now, while there's still time.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Tiny answers with more gunfire.  Karl turns on the engine the car radio and releases the emergency brake.  Country and Western blares.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: KARL RUNS behind it using it for cover -- TINY RAKES the front of the Van.  A wheel hits a rock jolting it off line -- The Van rolls past the cabin -- KARL DIVES on the porch rolling to safety --

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN RUNS RIGHT OFF THE BLUFF
dialogues.text: Crashing into the River below in a fiery explosion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AIT's go into action.  They're not waiting any longer Helicopter engine whines up --

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Reese can't see Karl anywhere from his vantage point. Tiny is yelling inside, demented, delirious.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Karl edges toward the back door, he primes his syringe, pumping himself up for the charge. A BALL OF FLAME ERUPTS inside.  Gasoline EXPLODES. FLAMES BILLOW out the windows. KARL reels back from the blast. REESE covers the AIT Leader.

dialogues.speaker: WITH KARL
dialogues.text: The rage builds in him erupting in a primal scream.  He rushes headlong crashing through the back door --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE FLAMES
dialogues.text: We're in the cabin.  Flames swirl about Tiny.  He's weak -- leaning against a post, gun dangling in his hand.  He turns to us.  His face hideous in the flames.  His clothe catch fire.  He hurls a flaming gas can right at us -- KARL CHARGES tackling the big man sending them crashing -

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: The two Men crash to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Karl pounds out the flames on Tiny's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you die on me!  Don't you dare!  Live Goddamnit.  I need a survivor -- damn you -- live! He dumps his respirator -- he desperately checks the big man's vital signs.  Reese runs up with the medical bag. THE HUEY SWOOPS UP over the bluff and lands.  AIT's jump out bringing more gear and the isolator. Two AIT's spray fire extinguishers on the burning cabin.

dialogues.speaker: TO TINY AND KARL
dialogues.text: Tiny is not responding to CPR.  Karl pumps air into his mouth.  Nothing. Karl rips open his shirt -- his body is covered with hemorrhages and skin ruptures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not dying on me, Tiny.  C'mon you son-of-a-bitch -- Reese hands him a big needle.  He shoots the adrenalin right in Tiny's heart.  Nothing.  He pounds the man's chest.  Reese pulls him back pinning him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  He's dead... Karl, angry at himself and the world, holds it all in.  H closes Tiny's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Over here -- Reese looks up, stunned by what he sees.  He grabs Karl.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: A GIRL walks out of the flaming smoldering Cabin.  Tiny's white trash girlfriend from the Roadhouse.  She's dazed, suffering from smoke inhalation, alive.  A survivor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that is a genuine miracle. Karl approaches her.  She reaches out both hands and collapses.  He catches her laying her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Virginia State Police. Clear the burning area -- Karl pays no attention checking the girl's vitals.  More Police and Rangers arrive up the fire road in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Rangers join the effort to put out the fire.  AIT's meet the Police keeping them away from potential contagion.

dialogues.speaker: WITH KARL AND THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Reese gives her oxygen.  Karl injects her with antivirals He checks her arms and neck for hemorrhages.  No petechiae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No symptoms.  Maybe she's incubating. He finds a small patch of symptomatic rash on her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got the bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?  For how long?  A week?  A day?  What's her temperature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-nine.  She's almost normal. She should be roasting if he infected her in the last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless... she's a survivor. Unless... she's immune. Karl looks at the girl.  Traumatized but her pulse is normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get her back to RIID. Now!  Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Huey lifts off leaving the Police and Rangers below dousing the fire.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COPTER
dialogues.text: Tiny's body bag lays on the floor.  Reese draws blood fro the Girl in the isolator.  She is delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim?  Where's Tim?  Have to take care of him.  He's so sick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (floored, realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was no hostage.  She liked the poor guy. Karl clamps a field centrifuge onto a seat back and begin cranking.  The blood sacks spin --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: They fly straight into the morning sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another corpse slides in the rack.  It's Girard.  There i no more room for bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie.  Her arm covered with petechiae.  The rest of her body is under the sheets.  We don't want to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jaxx, dark circles under her eyes, exhausted, studies a cell culture in the monitor attached to her microscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grow.  C'mon -- grow.  Maybe the CDR grafting didn't take. She turns to another monitor showing a complicated cell structure turning in 3D graphics.  The heading reads:

dialogues.speaker: "RECOMBINANT IG MOLECULES
dialogues.text: She rotates the diagram with key commands.  She looks up. Someone enters the lab in a spacesuit.  The figure moves closer.  It's Peter.  Weak and frail, but he's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete -- what are you doing -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm beating this thing, okay.  I feel good -- He does a wobbly James Brown in his spacesuit.  Jaxx is blown away he's even walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The irony of it all.  I wore this thing for years to keep the bugs out.  Now I'm wearing it to keep them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete?  Your fever broke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fever?  What fever?  Hey?  You trying to take credit for my work? "Synthetic generation of human antibodies by combination with super immune animal cells" by Peter Jahrling... Jaxx eyes him suspiciously.  He studies the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been grafting high immunity guinea pig cells to human myeloma cells, but the fusion hybridoma immortalizes only a few B cells. Low antibody production.  Useless against a mother-bug like Ebola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used Supermonk's IG genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.  Better gene match with humans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immunoglobulins won't clone. It's not working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your problem.  Change the binding site.  Splice the genes here and hope it grows up to be the Holy Grail. Peter makes some adjustments to the computer generated cell diagram. Jaxx looks at the screen in awe.  The two cells form one super immune cell.  (Computer graphic).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a genius, Pete.  Let's get you back to the slammer. He resists her, hugging the stool, barely able to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have to finish this.  If the human cells you're using are strong and healthy, this just might work. Whose are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. Peter looks at her through his helmet, he smiles --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd say if your daughter has any of the stuff her mother's made of -- her children and her grandchildren will be born immune -- Jaxx wells up at the hope he's given her.  Hope.  A final tear of blood trickles from his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- let's get you back to... the... slammer... Pete?  Pete! No answer.  Pete lumps over in his bluesuit -- and dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed Soldiers in gas masks surround the RIID building. Bradley Tanks block the roads in and out at Checkpoints. Media trucks line the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An estimated 47 exposed persons are being housed inside the RIID fortress, which is now completely quarantined and cut off from the outside world except by telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 deaths have now been reported since the outbreak began three days ago.  This tent ward behind me is for overflow cases the CDC and the U.S. Medical Corps hope never come. The Anchor walks us through the hospital tent that has been erected on the parade grounds.  ARMY MEDICAL CORPS MEN AND WOMEN are setting up rows of field cots. The THUD of a helicopter approaches.  Everyone looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Huey lands beside the building.  The AIT's hurry the stretcher bearing the Girl toward the wall hatch.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW KARL AND REESE
dialogues.text: Toward the guarded main entrance carrying blood vials and dangling the makeshift plasma bags on a coat hanger. Soldiers challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, no one is allowed in without authorization --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are people dying in there, I'm going to try and save them. He never breaks stride; the same phrase he said to the soldiers in Zaire. C.J. opens the door waving them in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let'em in.  C'mon.  What the hell have you been doing -- fishing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW THEM through the maze of beds and patients lining the corridors.  Karl carries the bags of serum lik the Holy Grail.  Doctors look up.  Staff step aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karl enters the Slammer Airlock and barrels past Maj. Hoskins -- Reese hangs back with C.J. WE FOLLOW KARL through the chem shower into --

dialogues.speaker: THE SLAMMER
dialogues.text: Hovering, waiting to take her next.  Both parents hold he hands through the glove ports. They are strangely not surprised to see Karl.  He stops short at the sight of Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing her, Karl. He shoves the plasma bags at Gerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put her on this.  Tiny bought the farm.  This is from his girlfriend. Reese spun the plasma phoresis in the chopper -- Check it for antibodies.  I think she's immune. I think she's the "magic bullet." They look at each other -- vaporlock.  Gerry grabs the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll screen it.  Just don't let Jamie die. He runs out shouting for C.J.  Karl hovers over Jamie -- hoping he's not too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete had a breakthrough.  He did it. We can crank out Ebola immune cell antibodies in a few weeks -- Jaxx is all nerve endings watching Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fast enough.  Let's get Pete on this new plasma too. He can tell by her reaction, Pete's dead.  He bows his head saying a silent goodbye.  Then grabs Jaxx --

dialogues.speaker: SLAMMER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Karl drags Jaxx into the last room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only chance Jamie or any of us have got.  Meet the donor. Maj. Hoskins tends the Girl.  She's sitting up in the isolator, completely alert -- a thermometer in her mouth. She glares at Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her temperature is normal, Doctor. Pulse stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where's Tim?  What is this place?  Anybody got a cigarette? Karl shakes his head no.  Jaxx checks her chart in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Angel." Jaxx looks to Karl.  What else --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.J. is on a phone hookup to CNN.  TV's show all networks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we hold out another 24 hours with no new cases, then our strategy to contain the outbreak has promise. We hope to have a synthetic antibody serum with strong efficacy in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all recognize the enormous risk CDC and Military personnel are taking by being in that building. Colonel -- will all the viruses and exposed patients inside with you, is there a danger of a virus escaping and infecting the entire community?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if it walks out in one of us.

dialogues.speaker: DESCENDS TO TAKE JAMIE
dialogues.text: Karl takes her blood pressure.  Blood oozes around the arm-strap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Jason to see her like this -- Gerry burst in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's clean.  No "hep."  HIV's negative.  And -- she's loaded with antibodies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing the thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- "Angel" has minimal symptoms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then Karl's right.  She must be immune. The whole slammer is buzzing.  Gerry looks to Jaxx for a decision.  Jaxx hooks the desperation plasma up herself.

dialogues.speaker: DESCENDS LOWER
dialogues.text: Jaxx gets right beside Jamie as close as the plastic will allow.  She whispers, determined not to give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You listen to me Jamie Magritte Jaxx, God gave you an immune system to fight disease with -- so fight. Don't think about anything else but living.  You want to do a triple twist -- live, Jamie, live.  You want to go to the Olympics don't you? She strokes Jamie's face through the glove port.  Gerry i right beside her.  Karl leans into view on the other side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick this bug in the ass.  Never, never, never, never give up -- If you live, your blood can save another and another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a privilege we've forgotten as humans, Jamie.  We can save each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoskins, Medical Staff, Jaxx, Johnson, Gerry all pitching in to hook up other ailing patients to the serum.  Faces we have seen; the Black Woman from Synergy, Loc's Vietnamese Wife.  Everyone pitches in. Jason pushes a cart of I.V.'s.  Gayle, Pete's grieving Wife shows up beside Jaxx.  She wants to help.  Klages an Godwin are there with C.J. --

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PLASMA BAGS
dialogues.text: All bear her one word name; "ANGEL."  Each bubbling life.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SLAMMER
dialogues.text: As one by one, the Team enters the Slammer through the airlock, exhausted, shedding tears, hopeful, holding onto each other -- all connected as they embrace Jaxx and Gerr and encircle Jamie in the isolator -- willing her to live

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW GLIDES TO JAMIE
dialogues.text: Feverish, staring into nothing.  Suddenly her eyes focus. A heavenly smile crosses her face.  She takes her parent' hands squeezing them tight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Spring.  Karl and Jaxx sit on the bank reflecting. Jaxx -- her head buried on her knees.  We can't tell what shape she's in.  Karl gives her a convalescent squeeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a day like this, we can pretend nature is benign -- and all the monsters and beasts in nature have their kinder moments. Jaxx looks up.  Quietly crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think it'd be this hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping her tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to get over it.  The wheel of life goes on, Nance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just see her lying there.  I don't know how I'll ever be able to -- to thank you and not start crying -- He laughs.  Now we here more laughter coming from the river.  Then a familiar voice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom -- look, Mom -- wahooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There in the middle of the beautiful Big Horn is Beautifu Jamie, full of life and joy.  She's caught a Rainbow trou and is reeling it in.  She's alive. Gerry fishes with her.  Jason wades upstream to net it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa -- must be a record catch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- for a "fisher-babe"! Brother and Sister again.  And Dad trying to moderate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Peter was here to share this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without his discovery, and Angel's precious blood.  We might not be here either.  Her synthesized antibodies saved a lot of lives.  He died a hero.  You should share a little credit too -- Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw -- Pete lived long enough to show me the way.  It's his legacy. Jaxx lays back taking in the beauty around them.

dialogues.speaker: THE RIVER
dialogues.text: Gerry helps Jamie set the fish free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we ready for the next one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't ready for this one.  This was a wakeup call.  We're just one international plane flight away from extinction. Jaxx sits up on that one staring at him.  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Say a tourist gets an unknown airborne virus in an African village in the morning, flies home that day, smoking, coughing -- sneezing. Aerosol droplets get circulated by the air vents -- so by the time you land, everyone onboard's been exposed.  Passengers walk through customs right back home exposing families, cabbies, friends.  Over night thousands are exposed.  Then the outbreak.  Slate wiper... Silence.  The sounds of nature abound.  Jaxx is riveted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inevitable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty soon us two-legged dinosaurs are history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother nature's revenge... God, I'll never fly again... Why not go back to Africa and find the viruses before they find us, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never should have left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better teach me to fish quick, because that's where you're going. Jaxx jumps up, brushing herself off.  Karl gets up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You raised so much hell, the CDC and the Army are joint funding a new research lab in the bush to find the reservoirs for Ebola, Marburg, AIDS, new bugs -- maybe some ancestors of some lost tribe I seem to recall you mentioning. She marches into the river with her fly rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is -- if you're interested. Karl is speechless for the first time in his life.  He grabs his favorite fishing hat -- rod -- big shiny grin - and follows her into the river.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG HORN
dialogues.text: This is how we leave them.  The Jaxx family and Karl Johnson fishing the Big Horn --

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEW CLIMBS TO
dialogues.text: Teeming with biological life, gleaming in the sun, threading like spaghetti through a geography of terrains. Like the cellscape we opened our story on -- we finish on -- Watching the river run...

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: 1.  To date the origin or reservoir of the Ebola virus is still unknown; there is still no vaccine for Ebola and no proven cure. 2.  The CDC levied fines against Synergy and three other primate companies and banned the shipment of monkeys into the United States for 18 months. 3.  No virus was found at the JFK animal unit where the monkeys entered the U.S.  The Philippine exporter would not allow a CDC/Army Team to inspect their animal quarantine unit. 4.  Monkeys with the Ebola virus were reported in primate quarantine units in Texas and Pennsylvania during the Reston outbreak. 5.  Nancy and Gerry Jaxx are both acting Colonels of Veterinary Medicine at USAMRIID and are actively involved in vaccine and viral research... including Ebola. 6.  Peter Jahrling is alive and well and Head of Virology at USAMRIID.  He continues his research on synthetic antibodies and is currently in South America isolating a new virus. 7.  C.J. Peters is now head of Special Pathogens at CDC i Atlanta.  He is currently in command of the CDC's efforts to control the spread of the Hantavirus outbreak in this country. 8.  Karl Johnson lives in Montana with his wife Merle nea the Gallatin River.  Karl isolated the Ebola virus in 1976, and the Hantavirus the same year.  If he isn't fishing, then Karl is currently consulting with C.J. Peters and the CDC on the Hantavirus outbreak in the U.S. that is still talking human lives as of this writing.
